article.class: post-7780 page type-page status-publish has-post-thumbnail hentry

p.span: In order to keep our school community as safe as possible and continue to slow the spread of COVID-19, all Center City PCS school buildings will remain closed for the rest of the academic year. This page will be regularly updated with distance learning materials and resources for our school community.

div.h2: The Mayor’s office has designated meal sites for all DC students from March 16 – April 24 from 10am – 12pm each weekday.

a.title: Citywide Meal Sites for All DC Students - Charter School Sites

p.a: Citywide Meal Sites for All DC Students – Charter School Sites

a.title: Citywide Meal Sites for All DC Students - DCPS Sites

br.a: Citywide Meal Sites for All DC Students – DCPS Sites
Community Resource Hub – Free Meals for Students and Seniors

div.p: Our teachers and specialists have created distance learning materials to be completed between April 6th and April 24th. Your campus principal will be reaching out soon to let you know what dates and times these materials will be available for pick-up in hard copy. Please note that students should complete the work assigned each day and bring the packets back to school with them on April 27th. Your child’s teachers will also be reaching out to set up check-in’s and tutoring hours throughout each week. In the meantime, we are providing links to all of the materials below. Given the size of each file, they may take a few minutes to download. Note that some of the Enrichment materials are campus specific.

span.a: Clever – Log into Clever to Access CCPCS Online Learning Portal for Reading and Math

br.a: Best Learning Apps & Games for Kids

a.title: Free Virtual Field Trips for Kids

br.a: Free Virtual Field Trips for Kids

br.br:
DC Emergency Shelter Hotline: 202-399-7093 or 311 available 24/7

div.p: Empower our students for lifelong success by building strong character, promoting academic excellence, and generating public service throughout Washington D.C.
